conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and how it will be directed into the containers D and E.
The baffles are labeled A, B, and C. The containers are labeled D and E.
Baffle A is at the top left, Baffle B is in the middle, and Baffle C is at the top right.
Liquid flowing through each baffle will be directed by the baffle.
The baffles have arrows indicating the direction of the flow.
Baffle A is directed towards the left side, so any liquid flowing through A will be directed towards the left.
Baffle B is directed towards the right side, so any liquid flowing through B will be directed towards the right.
Baffle C is directed towards the bottom, so any liquid flowing through C will be directed towards the bottom.
If liquid flows through A, it will be directed towards the left and will likely flow into container D.
If liquid flows through B, it will be directed towards the right and will likely flow into container D.
If liquid flows through C, it will be directed towards the bottom and will likely flow into container E.
Liquid flowing through A will flow into container D.
Liquid flowing through B will flow into container D.
Liquid flowing through C will flow into container E.
